We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Unit Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Uyo, Akwa Ibom 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties


	This is a full-time on-site role for a Unit Manager at Brit Property Nigeria Ltd.
	The Unit Manager will be responsible for overseeing daily operations, managing property units, coordinating with maintenance staff, handling tenant inquiries, and ensuring tenant satisfaction.
	The role will involve maintaining property standards, managing budgets, and implementing strategies to maximize occupancy and profitability.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an HND or Bachelor`s / Master`s Degree with 2 - 5 years work experience.
	Property Management, Real Estate, or related field experience
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively

N100,000 - N300,000 monthly.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Finance / Accounts Head",
  "description": "Smooth promotions (HIPTV) is a team family organization where we stay true to our values. We are on a journey to sustainably be the industry benchmark for quality and innovative service delivery to target audiences and clients. We also have the vision to optimize stakeholder value by consistently delivering superior returns on investment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Finance / Accounts Head

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Responsibilities


	Develop the financial strategy and align it with the Company&rsquo;s strategy
	Develop trends and projections for the Company&rsquo;s finances.
	Support to conduct reviews and evaluations for cost-reduction opportunities.
	Assist to prepare the company&rsquo;s budget.
	Preparation of monthly Management Report: Prepare quarterly financial reports - Profit &amp; Loss Statement, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow Statement to the Management team to enable us to know the financial performance and position of the company.
	Liaise with audit/tax consultants and finance regulatory bodies to ensure appropriate monitoring and compliance of company finances is maintained.
	Correspond with various other departments, discussing company plans and agreeing on future paths to be taken.
	Monitor all payable activities and provide a monthly report to enable you to have a planned treasury function.
	Account Receivable Services: You will monitor all Outgoing Invoices and prepare an aging report for easy tracking of what is due to the company from their clients yet to complete the payment (Debtors). You will prepare Invoices to suit Smooth Promotions agreement with our clients.
	You will work in conjunction with the Human Resources Department for effective and smooth administration of staff monthly payroll. The payroll will have to include what is to be paid to LIRS and our Pension Administrator.
	Collaborate with department heads/leads to prepare the Company&rsquo;s annual financial budget and ensure that all expenditures are budgeted clearly and systematically and presented to management for approval.
	Establish an investment strategy, provide advice on investment opportunities and asset allocations, and have an excellent knowledge of the financial markets.
	Ensure expenses are documented in detail, ensure controls are in place and detailed, monitoring on all expenses.
	Manage the Company&rsquo;s liquidity and mitigate its operational, financial and reputational risk.
	Build strong relationships with teammates, fostering trust and promoting collaboration &amp; handle confidential matters with discretion.
	And any other duties assigned to you in the course of your employment with us


Requirements

        Punch is a full-service digital agency. We are designers, engineers, and marketers on a mission to build the best digital experiences.

We champion a boutique approach to product development. We have small teams, the best talent, and a horizontal management structure. The goal is to create a natural partner for your organization.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Dart / Flutter Developer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Job Type: Full-time

What We Look For
     

            
    




	We are seeking a skilled Dart/Flutter Developer to join our team.
	In this role, you will design and develop high-performance, cross-platform mobile applications for both iOS and Android platforms using the Flutter framework and Dart programming language.
	You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and implement new features, ensuring a seamless and engaging user experience.

	Design, develop, test, maintain, and deploy software using the Flutter framework and Dart language.
	Translate UI/UX designs into high-quality, responsive code.

	Implement and maintain state management solutions to ensure efficient and maintainable code.
	Optimize application performance for maximum speed and scalability.
	Conduct thorough testing and debugging to ensure high-quality, reliable applications.
	Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies to ensure our applications remain current and competitive.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.

	Familiarity with state management solutions such as Provider, Riverpod, or Bloc.

	Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Experience with Firebase or other backend services.
	Knowledge of continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.
	Understanding of Agile development methodologies.

	Oversee disciplinary procedures, conflict resolution, and grievance handling in line with the company’s policy.
	Provide internal consulting support to new or growing business units, offering guidance on structure, staffing, and HR frameworks.
	Where applicable, collaborate with external HR consultants or advisory partners to support organizational development initiatives.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (master’s degree preferred).
	Minimum of 11 years of progressive HR experience, with at least 4 years in a leadership role—preferably in fintech or fast-paced financial services.
	Professional certification (ACIPM, SPHRI, SHRM).
	Experience working in startups or scaling organizations.
	Strong knowledge of employment law, employment relations, and industry trends.
	Demonstrated experience managing HR operations across multiple companies or business units.
	Strong background in HR strategy, organizational development, and operational excellence.
	Exceptional leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
	Tech-savvy with experience using HR tools and platforms (HRIS, ATS, LMS).
